decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, then bringing them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this combo-reanimator deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the board. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual allow for fast mana acceleration, helping the deck to execute its game plan efficiently and effectively.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy using disruptive creatures and removal spells. With a focus on efficient creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic, along with powerful removal like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the board. By utilizing Aether Vial and Recruiter of the Guard to quickly search for key creatures, the deck can adapt to different game situations and outmaneuver the opponent. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck gains additional value from flickering creatures and generating card advantage.

The main focus of the deck is to maintain control of the game while applying pressure on the opponent through aggressive and disruptive plays. The deck utilizes a combination of efficient creatures, hand disruption spells, and strong removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. By maintaining tempo and disrupting the opponent's resources, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control early in the game with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while deploying efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes counterspells such as Force of Will and Daze to protect its board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to tempo out the opponent by applying constant pressure while controlling the game with a mix of disruption and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down the opponent, while also utilizing counterspells like Force of Will to protect its own game plan. The creatures in the deck are versatile, with abilities that can help control the board or provide card advantage. The deck also includes a combination of mana acceleration and powerful enchantments to help further its aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this Cradle Control deck is to ramp up mana quickly using creatures like Elvish Mystic, Fyndhorn Elves, and Llanowar Elves, along with Gaea's Cradle, to cast powerful spells such as Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Allosaurus Shepherd to control the board and protect your creatures. With the ability to search for specific creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Endurance using Fiend Artisan, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of mana acceleration and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with efficient creatures and removal spells. By combining disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and force the opponent to react to your threats. The inclusion of card draw and selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm help ensure that you have the right cards at the right time, giving you the advantage in each matchup.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to efficiently control the board with removal spells and counterspells while deploying aggressive threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to quickly close out the game. The deck also uses card filtering effects like Ponder, Mishra's Bauble, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to maximize consistency and find key pieces. Wasteland is included to disrupt opponents' mana bases, and the deck can switch gears to a more controlling strategy with cards like Brazen Borrower and Thundering Falls when needed.

This deck focuses on using cheap spells and aggressive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic, bounce spells, and land destruction while building up a strong board presence with efficient threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. By controlling the tempo of the game and applying pressure early on, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a combo that allows for a game-winning play. It utilizes a variety of creatures and spells to mill through the deck and eventually put Thassa's Oracle on the battlefield to win the game on the spot. The deck includes various ways to generate mana fast, protect the combo with Pact of Negation, and has options for graveyard recursion. The key goal is to execute the combo as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to interact with the strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to establish a quick and aggressive board presence, primarily through the use of cards like Chalice of the Void, Mishra's Bauble, and Urza's Bauble. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga play key roles in recurring and tutoring these artifacts. The inclusion of Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer helps to maintain pressure on the opponent while also providing control elements with cards like Force of Will. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and versatile artifact-based strategy in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to utilize efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also having removal in cards like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck aims to apply early pressure by playing threats quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan to maintain control of the game. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to be proactive and aggressive in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan while also generating incremental card advantage and value through various spells and creatures. The deck includes a mix of removal, counterspells, card draw, and threats to create a versatile game plan that can adapt to different matchups. The goal is to outvalue the opponent while disrupting their plans, ultimately gaining control of the game and securing a victory through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board through a combination of disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze, removal spells like Fatal Push, and efficient creatures like Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game while maintaining card advantage and control over the game state. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares adds additional versatility and threat to the deck's game plan. Overall, this deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure with efficient and powerful creatures such as Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent. Utilizing counter magic like Daze and Force of Will, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and quickly close out matches. The deck also includes card selection and manipulation tools like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Mishra's Bauble to ensure consistent draws and maximize efficiency.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play using reanimation spells. It uses cards like Careful Study and Thoughtseize to set up the graveyard, while also protecting the combo with counterspells like Force of Will. The key strategy is to cheat out high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck has ways to control the board with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tainted Indulgence.
